data.title: Birth Control, STD Testing & Abortion
data.meta_description: Visit New Haven Center for family planning services, including STD testing and abortions. Make an appointment with Planned Parenthood.
data.text:
Appointment Policies and Information

From the North:

Take I-91 South to Exit 3 (Trumbull Street). Go straight through the light and continue straight on Trumbull Street to the first light. Take a right onto Whitney Avenue. Continue north on Whitney Avenue for three traffic lights to Edwards Street. Turn right on Edwards Street. The entrance is the first driveway on the left.

From the South:

Take I-95 North to I-91 North towards Hartford/Springfield. Take Exit 3 (Trumbull Street). Go straight through light and continue straight on Trumbull St. to the first light. Take a right onto Whitney Avenue. Continue north on Whitney Avenue for three traffic lights to Edwards Street. Turn right on Edwards Street. The entrance is the driveway on the left.

From the West:

Take Route 63 (Whalley Avenue), all the way into Downtown New Haven where it turns into Elm Street. Take a left on Church Street. Go several blocks, and Church becomes Whitney Avenue. Continue north on Whitney Avenue for four traffic lights to Edwards Street. Turn right on Edwards Street. The entrance is the first driveway on the left.

From the East:

Take I-95 South to I-91 North towards Hartford/Springfield and take Exit 3 (Trumbull Street). Go straight through light and continue straight on Trumbull Street to the first light. Take a right onto Whitney Avenue. Continue north on Whitney Avenue for three traffic lights to Edwards Street. Turn right on Edwards Street. The entrance is the first driveway on the left.

*Parking is located behind the building.

Getting a physical for school or employment? Please bring all of the required forms with you.

Childcare Policies

We’re unable to provide childcare at our health center. For safety reasons children need to be accompanied by an adult when they’re in the waiting room. Only infants can accompany you to the exam room. Please bring a friend or family member to be with your children if you don’t have childcare at home.

Accessibility Options

We provide educational materials specifically for people with developmental disabilities.

Specially trained staff and medical equipment are available for people with physical disabilities.

Services Offered

You can fill your birth control prescriptions at our health center instead of the pharmacy. during business hours

You can come to us for services that don’t require a medical exam. For example, birth control education and supplies; emergency contraception (AKA the morning after pill); pregnancy testing and counseling; STD testing, and testing and treatments for urinary tract infections.
